body:
We are definitely aware of the ongoing pain points with the keyboard
shortcuts. I love the way you put it :)

Internally, the core devs have played around with other approaches and none
have emerged as clear victors. We plan on doing some quantitive usability
studies to try and identify the best way of handling this. In the meantime,
we strongly encourage everyone to customize their shortcuts and try to
figure out what works best for them.

On Sun, Jul 20, 2014 at 7:15 AM, Heikki Arponen notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I'd much prefer if edit mode was default (nasty things have happened
> indeed with flipping to command mode after each eval...).
> 
> I think this post is a great example:
> http://stackoverflow.com/a/22898833/742616
>

> https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/6173.

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
@ellisonbg on Twitter and GitHub
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com

OK I'm glad it's not yet set in stone, thanks :)
